title:
Fractionalization of flux tubes in 3d and screening by emergent electric
  charges in 2d
abstract:
We consider a class of 3d theories with a $\mathbb Z_n$ magnetic symmetry in
which confinement is generated by charge $n$ clusters of monopoles. Such
theories naturally arise in quantum antiferromagnets in 2+1, QCD-like theories
on $\mathbb R^3 \times S^1$, and $U(1)$ lattice theory with restricted monopole
sums. A confining string fractionates into $n$ strings which each carry $1/n$
electric flux. We construct a twisted compactification (equivalently periodic
compactification with a topological defect insertion) on $\mathbb R^2 \times
S^1$ that preserves the vacuum structure. Despite the absence of electric
degrees of freedom in the microscopic Lagrangian, we show that large Wilson
loops are completely/partially screened for even/odd $n$, even when the
compactification scale is much larger than the Debye length. We show the
emergence of fractional electric charges $(\pm 2/n)$ at the junctions of the
domain lines and topological defects. We end with some remarks on screening vs.
confinement.
